intro: Scabiosa thracica, commonly known as the Thrace scabious, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Europe. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, clustered inflorescences of pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a fuzzy texture. Scabiosa thracica is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting pollinators.
